Detailed Description

Status object.

Each object, when initialised, gets a status object which olds information about the last action that was performed.

Author:
Oscar van Eijk, Oveas Functionality Provider
Version:
Aug 11, 2008 -- O van Eijk -- Initial version

Member Function Documentation

OWLStatus::__constructor ( $  code = OWL_STATUS_WARNING  ) 

Constructor; should be called only by _OWL::init(). The default status is initially a (generic) warning status. It should be set to any successfull status after object initialisation completed.

Parameters:
[in] $code The status code

OWLStatus::set_code ( $  code = OWL_STATUS_BUG  ) 

Set the status of the owner object to the given value.

Parameters:
[in] $code The status code
Returns:
The severity level of the code

OWLStatus::reset (  ) 

Reset the object status

OWLStatus::set_params ( $  params  ) 

If the status was set with optional parameters, they will be set in this subject and substituted in the correct message

Parameters:
[in] $params An array with parameters

OWLStatus::get_severity (  ) 

Check the status of the given object and return its severity.

Returns:
The severity level of the current status

OWLStatus::get_code (  ) 

Return the status code

Returns:
The status code

OWLStatus::get_message (  ) 

Retrieve the message that has been specified for the current object status. If parameters are set and wanted by the message text, replace them. If more parameters are available then used in the message, there's a quote with the unused parameter count added to the message.

Returns:
The message text

Member Data Documentation

OWLStatus::$code [private]

Current object status

OWLStatus::$params [private]

Array with parameters that will be substituted in message text
